intro: Pulicaria hadramautica, commonly known as the Hadramaut pulicaria, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is typically low-growing, with hairy stems and small, yellowish flower heads that bloom in the spring. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Pulicaria hadramautica plays a role in stabilizing desert soils and providing habitat for local wildlife.
